item.title: How To Solve It by George Polya
item.description: There are 4 phases to solving a problem: Undestanding the problem. ask the questions “What is the unknown?”, “What is the data?”, “What is the condition?” “Is it possible to satisfy the condition?” look at the unknown and try to find a problem with a similar unknown; introduce new notation (variables names for lengths, etc) draw a figure, and point out the unknown and the known on it Seeing how the items are connected (how the unknown is linked to data), in order to make a plan.
